Name:
Chao Ho (肇和)
Chao Ho (肇和)
Fate:
sunk 28 September 1937 by Japanese Aircraft
reintegrated into the Republic of China Navy
Propulsion: Three-shaft Parsons steam turbines, 4 cylindrical and 4 Yarrow boilers; 6,000 hp (4,500 kW)
Range: 4,500 nmi (8,300 km) at 10 kn (12 mph; 19 km/h)
Armament:
2 x 1 - Armstrong Pattern NN 6-inch (152 mm)/50 guns[1]
4 x 1 - Elswick Pattern P 4 in (100 mm)/50 guns[2]
4 x 1 - Armstrong 3 in (76 mm) guns
6 x 1 - 47/40 Hotchkiss guns
2 × 37 mm (1 in) Maxim AA guns
2 × 450 mm (18 in) torpedo tubes
Armour:
Deck: 19 to 25 mm (0.75 to 0.98 in)
Conning tower: 76 mm (3.0 in)
